content.description: An athletic trainer wanted to investigate the relationship between an athlete’s resting heart rate and the heart rate after exercise. From a sample of <math alttext="12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> athletes, the athletic trainer recorded each athlete’s resting heart rate, in beats per minute, and heart rate, in beats per minute, after <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes of moderate exercise. The results of a regression analysis of the data are shown in the following computer output.
content.question: Predictor <math alttext="Coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Standard Error of Coefficient" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>SE Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant <math alttext="17.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="29.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>29.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.563" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.563</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Resting Heart Rate <math alttext="1.786" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.453" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.453</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3.94" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.94</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.003" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.003</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="S equals 9.9702" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>9.9702</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R squared, equals 60.88%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-Sq</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>60.88</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Assume the conditions for inference are met. Which of the following represents a <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence for the slope of the population regression line?

choices.label: <math alttext="17.5 plus or minus, 1.96 times 29.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17.5</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>29.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.786 plus or minus, 1.96 times 0.453" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.453</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.786 plus or minus, 1.96 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 0.453 over the square root of 12, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.96</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.453</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.786 plus or minus, 2.228 times, open parenthesis, the fraction 0.453 over the square root of 12, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.228</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.453</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.786 plus or minus, 2.228 times 0.453" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.228</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.453</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.786 plus or minus, 2.228 times 0.453" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.786</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.228</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.453</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
